docs.snippet: Estadio das Dunas in Natal will hold 42,000 spectators for four World Cup matches at this year's tournament.
docs.lead_paragraph: Estadio das Dunas in Natal will hold 42,000 spectators for four World Cup matches at this year's tournament.

headline.main: Natal _ It Means Christmas _ Hosts 4 Matches
headline.print_headline: Natal _ It Means Christmas _ Hosts 4 Matches

docs.snippet: With famous beaches and world-renowned attractions such as the Christ the Redeemer statue and Sugar Loaf mountain, Rio de Janeiro has plenty to see even without the World Cup.
docs.lead_paragraph: With famous beaches and world-renowned attractions such as the Christ the Redeemer statue and Sugar Loaf mountain, Rio de Janeiro has plenty to see even without the World Cup.

headline.main: Familiar Rio: Christ the Redeemer, Maracana

docs.snippet: The White House says Uruguay's president is planning to visit next month.

headline.print_headline: Obama Plans to Host Uruguay's President Next Month

docs.snippet: Italy coach Cesare Prandelli has warned that players won't be considered for the World Cup if they are sent off or caught misbehaving in club matches before the end of the season.
docs.lead_paragraph: Italy coach Cesare Prandelli has warned that players won't be considered for the World Cup if they are sent off or caught misbehaving in club matches before the end of the season.

headline.main: Misbehave and You Won't Make World Cup Squad-Italy Coach
headline.print_headline: Misbehave and You Won't Make World Cup Squad-Italy Coach

docs.snippet: With the revelations that a U.S. agency secretly developed a Twitter-like network for Cuba, we ask experts if the United States is justified in using assistance to promote democracy and other political changes abroad?
docs.abstract: With the revelations that a U.S. agency secretly developed a Twitter-like network for Cuba, we ask experts if the United States is justified in using assistance to promote democracy and other political changes abroad?

docs.snippet: Uruguayan President Jose Mujica has declared $322,883 in wealth.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguayan President Jose Mujica has declared $322,883 in wealth.

docs.snippet: Despite a high-profile first year as the head of the Vatican, Pope Francis has not been able to stem the tide of fellow Latin Americans turning away from Catholicism and toward Evangelicalism, or secularism in more prosperous countries.
docs.lead_paragraph: Despite a high-profile first year as the head of the Vatican, Pope Francis has not been able to stem the tide of fellow Latin Americans turning away from Catholicism and toward Evangelicalism, or secularism in more prosperous countries.

headline.main: Pope Struggles to Keep Fellow Latin Americans in Catholic Fold: Poll
headline.print_headline: Pope Struggles to Keep Fellow Latin Americans in Catholic Fold: Poll

docs.snippet: President Jose Mujica says his wealth adds up to $322,883. Nearly a third of that is cash, kept in three bank accounts that Uruguay's leader didn't previously declare.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Jose Mujica says his wealth adds up to $322,883. Nearly a third of that is cash, kept in three bank accounts that Uruguay's leader didn't previously declare.

docs.snippet: Liverpool striker Daniel Sturridge is an injury concern ahead of the English Premier League leaders' trip to Norwich City on Sunday because of a muscle strain.

headline.main: Sturridge a Doubt for Liverpool's Trip to Norwich
headline.print_headline: Sturridge a Doubt for Liverpool's Trip to Norwich

docs.snippet: Liverpool trio Luis Suarez, Steven Gerrard and Daniel Sturridge are on the shortlist for the English Professional Footballers' Association (PFA) player of the year award.
